data.title: Triangle midpoint
data.solution:
import sys

xs = []
ys = []

for _ in range(3):
    x, y = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
    xs += [x]
    ys += [y]

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

print(f"{sum(xs)/3:.2f} {sum(ys)/3:.2f}")
data.statement:
You are given the three corner points of a triangle as coordinates in the plane. 
Find the midpoint of the triangle given.

<<The math:>>
A triangle's midpoint is the point with the shortest possible sum of the distance to the three corners.
Imagine drawing a line from any of the three corners to the middle point of the opposite side of the triangle. These three lines meet at a single point known as the triangle midpoint, geometric center, centroid, or middle point.
Your task is to provide the coordinates of this middle point of the triangle given.
data.constraints: All coordinate values given are integers in the range -1000 <= [[value]] <= 1000 and will always represent a valid triangle.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given the three corner points of a triangle as coordinates in the plane.
Find the midpoint of the triangle given.

The math:
A triangle's midpoint is the point with the shortest possible sum of the distance to the three corners.
Imagine drawing a line from any of the three corners to the middle point of the opposite side of the triangle. These three lines meet at a single point known as the triangle midpoint, geometric center, centroid, or middle point.
Your task is to provide the coordinates of this middle point of the triangle given.
Input
Coordinates (x, y) of the corners A, B, and C. One corner-point per line and with x-y space-separated.
Line 1: A: xa ya
Line 2: B: xb yb
Line 3: C: xc yc
Output
Coordinates of the midpoint rounded to two decimal places.
x and y on one line space-seperated.
Constraints
All coordinate values given are integers in the range -1000 <= value <= 1000 and will always represent a valid triangle.
Example
Input
0 0
3 0
0 3
Output
1.00 1.00
